section.title: Introduction
section.p: The web interface allows the console to be controlled from a web browser. We expect that it will eventually replace the classic interface. The web interface has several advantages. It can be accessed concurrently by more than one user. It can be used from any computer on networked to the console host machine. The user interface is modern, and is mashable into other interfaces and portals.

The initial release in The Grinder 3.12 is usable, but does not have the full capability of the classic interface. In particular, saving results, script distribution, and script editing are all missing. Until these features have been implemented, you may want to use the classic interface and the web interface together.

section.title: How to access the web interface
section.p: The web interface shares its configuration with the console service. With the default configuration, once the console process has started, you can access the web console on your local computer at http://localhost:6373/ui.

The default configuration binds to all local interfaces, so you can change localhost in the URL to an externally accessible host name or IP address. You should understand the security implications of remote access.
